text: Norman Douglas Wilson (1884-1967) was a Toronto-based transportation engineer who designed the Toronto subway, and created a design of a subway for Winnipeg in the late 1950s. ==See also== * Wilson Avenue – a street in Toronto named for him * Wilson (TTC) - a subway station on the above-mentioned street * Wilson Heights, Toronto - a neighbourhood near the above-mentioned street * Wilson Heights (electoral district) - named for the above mention neighbourhood ==References== * Category:1884 births Category:1967 deaths Category:Canadian engineers Category:People from Toronto Category:20th-century engineers
title: Norman D. Wilson
